actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Jackson (TX) amendment No. 20.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Jackson (TX),  numbered 20 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds from being used by the NNSA to halt the construction of the HE Synthesis, Formulation, and Production facility at Pantex.
On agreeing to the Houlahan amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Houlahan amendment No. 19.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Houlahan,  numbered 19 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to increase and decrease funding for the Grid Deployment account by $150 million to emphasize the need to address domestic shortages of large power transformers and distribution transformers through authorities within the Defense Production Act.
On agreeing to the Hageman amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Hageman amendment No. 18.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Hageman,  numbered 18 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit the Department of Energy from implementing the Industrial Decarbonization Roadmap.
On agreeing to the Griffith amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Griffith amendment No. 17.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Griffith,  numbered 17 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to increase funding for the Department of Energy's Fossil Energy and Carbon Management program by $8,750,000 while reducing funding for Departmental Administration by $8,750,000.
On agreeing to the Beyer amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Beyer amendment No. 11.

An amendment, offered by Mr. Beyer,  numbered 11 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds made available by this Act to be used for the Savannah River Plutonium Modernization Program.
On agreeing to the Beyer amendment; Failed by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Beyer amendment No. 10.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Beyer,  numbered 10 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds made available for this Act to be used for the W87-1 modification program.
On agreeing to the Flood amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Flood amendment No. 9.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Flood,  numbered 9 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funding for lab-grown meat at the Department of Energy.
On agreeing to the Brecheen amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Brecheen amendment No. 4.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Brecheen,  numbered 4 printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 to prohibit funds to reinstate the general license for export of nuclear material to China.
On agreeing to the Fleischmann amendments; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1370, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 20 minutes of debate on the Fleischmann amendment en bloc.

Amendments en bloc  offered by Mr. Fleischmann,  comprised of the following amendments printed in Part A of House Report 118-602 as en bloc: Nos. 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12, 13, 14, 15, 21, 24, 26, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 33, 34, 39, 52, 57, 58, 59, and 65.
The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate on H.R. 8997.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Brad R. Wenstrup to act as Chairman of the Committee.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 1370 and Rule XVIII.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8997 and H.R. 8998. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 8997 and H.R. 8998 under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1370. H.R. 8997 — "Making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 404
actions-list.actionItem: 3 (Roll no. 362).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 227 — "To amend title 28, United States Code, to provide an additional place for holding court for the Pecos Division of the Western District of Texas, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 361).

Considered as unfinished business. S. 3706 — "To amend section 3663A of title 18, United States Code, to clarify that restitution includes necessary and reasonable expenses incurred by a person who has assumed the victim's rights."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 211
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 188

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 1370 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8997) making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8998) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on ordering the previous question on H. Res. 1370, agreeing to H. Res. 1370, if ordered, and motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 23.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 1370, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1370.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1370 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8997) making appropriations for energy and water development and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8998) making appropriations for the Department of the Interior, environment, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mrs. Ramirez to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable John W. Rose to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
